TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SqlMethods extends System.Object
public ref class SqlMethods abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides methods that correspond to SQL Server functions. Methods in the class are only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.
Counts the number of day boundaries between two specified dates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the SQL Server `DATEDIFF` function using `day` to specify the type of time boundary crossed. For more about this SQL Server function, see [DATEDIFF](/sql/t-sql/functions/datediff-transact-sql).

MemberSignature.Value: public static int DateDiffDay (DateTime startDate, DateTime endDate);
.method public static hidebysig int32 DateDiffDay(valuetype System.DateTime startDate, valuetype System.DateTime endDate) cil managed
Public Shared Function DateDiffDay (startDate As DateTime, endDate As DateTime) As Integer
public: static int DateDiffDay(DateTime startDate, DateTime endDate);
static member DateDiffDay : DateTime * DateTime -> int

Docs.param: The start date for the time period.
The end date for the time period.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of day boundaries between two non-nullable dates.
Docs.returns: The number of day boundaries between the two specified dates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the SQL Server `DATEDIFF` function using `day` to specify the type of time boundary crossed. For more about this SQL Server function, see [DATEDIFF](/sql/t-sql/functions/datediff-transact-sql).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the SQL Server `DATEDIFF` function using `nanosecond` to specify the type of time boundary crossed. For more about this SQL Server function, see [DATEDIFF](/sql/t-sql/functions/datediff-transact-sql).

Docs.summary: Determines whether a specific character string matches a specified pattern. This method is currently only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SQL Server `LIKE` functionality cannot be exposed through translation of existing common language runtime (CLR) and .NET Framework constructs, and is unsupported outside of a LINQ to SQL context. The use of this method outside of LINQ to SQL will always throw an exception of type <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (string matchExpression, string pattern);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(string matchExpression, string pattern) cil managed
Public Shared Function Like (matchExpression As String, pattern As String) As Boolean
public: static bool Like(System::String ^ matchExpression, System::String ^ pattern);
static member Like : string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The string to be searched for a match.
The pattern, which may include wildcard characters, to match in .
Docs.summary: Determines whether a specific character string matches a specified pattern. This method is currently only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.
Docs.returns: if matches the pattern; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SQL Server `LIKE` functionality cannot be exposed through translation of existing common language runtime (CLR) and .NET Framework constructs, and is unsupported outside of a LINQ to SQL context. The use of this method outside of LINQ to SQL will always throw an exception of type <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (string matchExpression, string pattern, char escapeCharacter);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(string matchExpression, string pattern, char escapeCharacter) cil managed
Public Shared Function Like (matchExpression As String, pattern As String, escapeCharacter As Char) As Boolean
public: static bool Like(System::String ^ matchExpression, System::String ^ pattern, char escapeCharacter);

Docs.param: The string to be searched for a match.
The pattern, which may include wildcard characters, to match in .
The character to put in front of a wildcard character to indicate that it should be interpreted as a regular character and not as a wildcard character.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a specific character string matches a specified pattern. This method is currently only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.
Docs.returns: if matches the pattern; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SQL Server `LIKE` functionality cannot be exposed through translation of existing common language runtime (CLR) and .NET Framework constructs, and is unsupported outside of a LINQ to SQL context. The use of this method outside of LINQ to SQL will always throw an exception of type <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
